Course Description: THIS COURSE PROVIDES STUDENTS WITH AN IN-DEPTH UNDERSTANDING OF ACCOUNTING PROCEDURES AND SPECIALIZED TREATMENT OF FINANCIAL STATEMENT ITEMS, CASH AND TEMPORARY ASSETS, RECEIVABLES, INVENTORIES (GENERAL AND ESTIMATING PROCEDURES), CURRENT LIABILITIES, INCOME-TAX PROCEDURES IN ACCOUNTING AND THE ACQUISITION, USE, AND RETIREMENT OF LONG-TERM PLANT ASSETS.
Objectives / Learning Outcome(s) / Major:
1. EXPLAIN THE UNDERLYING CONCEPTS IN FINANCIAL REPORTING, THE ACCOUNTING STANDARD-SETTING PROCESS AND THE FASB CONCEPTUAL FRAMEWORK.
2. IDENTIFY, EXPLAIN, AND IMPLEMENT BASIC STEPS IN THE ACCOUNTING CYCLE.
3. DESCRIBE THE SPECIFIC ELEMENTS OF THE BALANCE SHEET AND IDENTIFY AND IMPLEMENT DIFFERENT FORMATS USED TO PRESENT BALANCE SHEET DATA.
4. EXPLAIN THE CONCEPT OF INCOME AND IMPORTANCE OF INCOME MEASURE AND DISCUSS AND IMPLEMENT THE FORMAT AND SPECIFIC COMPONENTS OF THE INCOME STATEMENT.
5. IDENTIFY SPECIFIC COMPONENTS OF THE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS AND PREPARE A COMPLETE STATEMENT OF CASH FLOWS, INCLUDING REQUIRED SUPPLEMENTAL DISCLOSURES.
6. IDENTIFY PRIMARY CRITERIA FOR REVENUE RECOGNITION, AND RECORD JOURNAL ENTRIES RELATED TO REVENUE TRANSACTIONS, INCLUDING LONG-TERM CONSTRUCTION TYPE CONTRACTS USING PERCENTAGE-OF-COMPLETION AND COMPLETED-CONTRACT METHODS AND LONG-TERM SERVICE TYPE CONTRACTS.
7. DISCUSS, ANALYZE AND APPLY CONCEPTS RELATING TO INVENTORY VALUATION AND IDENTIFICATION AND COST OF GOODS SOLD.
8. DISCUSS, ANALYZE AND APPLY CONCEPTS RELATING TO INVESTMENTS IN NONCURRENT OPERATING ASSETS ACQUISITIONS, UTILIZATION AND RETIREMENT.
Transfer Status: GUARANTEED TRANSFER TO INSTITUTION OFFERING SAME COURSE.
